gambler
Class GamblerGame

java.lang.Object
  environment.AbstractEnvironmentSingle
      gambler.GamblerGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEnvironment, IEnvironmentSingle, java.io.Serializable, ValueIteration
public class GamblerGame
extends AbstractEnvironmentSingle
implements ValueIteration

A simple game :

  • The player has an initial capital.
  • His aim is to reach 100
  • He can bet as much money as he wants, provided he has it.
  • He flips a coins and wins with probability p.
    • .
  • If he wins, he is credited with its bet.
  • Otherwise, he looses it.
  • He wins when reaching a capital of 100
  • He looses when he runs out of money.
Description of this game can be found in Sutton & Barto page 101.

Some functions are added outside the definition of Contraintes, to apply value iteration, finding optimal policy, and plot Q(s,a) values, in order to compare with the book discussion : see manual and example.

See Also:

whoWins

public int whoWins(IState s)
Description copied from interface: IEnvironment
Who won ?
  • Two-players game :
    • Player One : -1
    • Tie : 0
    • Player Two : 1
  • Single-player game :
    • Win : -1
    • Null: 0
    • Loose: 1
